name: shale quarry operation | shale | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12039/documentation

This dataset represent the extraction of shale in Quebec in 2012. Specific data were collected from the only producer of brick (made from shale) in Quebec, with an annual production of 70'000 tons. ;;The assumed thickness of shale on the site is 90 feet (sampling reveal the presence of shale at this depht) and because 30 feet has been used in the last 100 years, the total lifetime is estimated to 300 years.; ;No shale quarry construction is needed since the infrastructures are associated with the brick production. Therefore only the land transformation related to the quarry opening is accounted for in the current dataset. 

This activity start from the transformation of the land to create the shale production site (quarry).

This activity ends with the transportation of the shale to the brick production facility.

The dataset includes excavation by digger, transportation to the grinding machine (brick production), the land-use of the mining and the recultivation area ("recultivation, bauxite mine" has been used as Proxy).

This dataset doesn't include the machinery for the site preparation and site closure.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The dataset represents the activity in 2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module represents the land use and the diesel consumption from the only producer of brick in Quebec. Estimation for the recultivation is a rough estimation based on an existing european dataset (limestone mine). Uncertainty adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology for Quebec shale mining
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Shale layer and diesel consumption based on the only Quebec brick producer. Other information is rough estimation. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Estimations from data provider and similar processes.

exchanges.description: Measured Value. Represent the extraction of shale used for brick shale production in Quebec in 2012.
